title: Electromagnetism as Propagating Torsion in a Hydrodynamic Vacuum:  A Geometric Unification via Cartan Structure Equations
description:
Abstract

We present a geometric reformulation of electromagnetism based on the hydrodynamics of a structured, director-bearing, inviscid, and incompressible substrate. Using Cartan’s structure equations in a teleparallel (Weitzenböck) geometry, we identify the electromagnetic field strength 2-form as the projection of spacetime torsion along a fixed internal direction, \( F \equiv \kappa u_a T^a \), which guarantees the Bianchi identity \( dF=0 \). In this framework, the photon emerges not as a fundamental point particle, but as a massless transverse shear-like wave of the substrate’s director field.

From an effective hydrodynamic (gauge-fixed) Lagrangian that is equivalent to the Maxwell action, we obtain the linearized vector wave equation and demonstrate that the speed of light \( c \) is determined by the ratio of the substrate's effective shear stiffness to its effective mass density. Furthermore, we predict a vacuum magneto-optical response: in the presence of a parity-odd substrate coupling aligned with a background field, a non-zero vacuum Verdet constant (linear-in-\( B \) Faraday rotation) arises—distinct from the parity-even, quadratic-in-\( B \) birefringence of standard Quantum Electrodynamics (QED). This framework offers falsifiable targets for high-intensity laser experiments and magnetar polarimetry.

Key Mathematical & Physical Results:

  • Geometric Unification: The electromagnetic potential \( A_\mu \) is identified with the coframe displacement of the vacuum substrate, and the field strength  \( F_{\mu\nu} \) is identified with projected Cartan Torsion.

  • Massless Shear Modes: The "director-bearing" (nematic-like) nature of the substrate allows for transverse wave propagation without viscous damping, resolving historical drag paradoxes.

  • Vacuum Faraday Rotation: A derivation of the Vacuum Verdet constant, \( \mathcal{V}_{\text{vac}} \approx \alpha_{\text{vac}}/2 \), predicting a linear optical rotation in vacuum distinct from the Euler-Heisenberg QED prediction.

 

Keywords

 

Electromagnetism, Cartan Geometry, Spacetime Torsion, Hydrodynamic Vacuum, Analogue Gravity, Vacuum Birefringence, Verdet Constant, Topological Fluid Dynamics, Teleparallel Gravity, Unified Field Theory

 

Notes

 

This work bridges the gap between classical fluid mechanics and modern gauge field theories using differential geometry. It provides a rigorous mathematical derivation of Maxwell's equations from a mechanical substrate, offering a tangible ontology for the quantum vacuum compatible with relativistic observations in the low-energy limit.
